name: Radioactive Decay
explanation: Radioactive decay follows exponential law: N(t) = N₀e^(-λt) where λ is decay constant. Half-life (T₁/₂) is time for half of atoms to decay: T₁/₂ = ln(2)/λ. Each radioactive isotope has characteristic half-life. Used in radiometric dating, medical imaging, and understanding nuclear processes. Decay is random but statistically predictable.

examples.problem: Carbon-14 has half-life 5730 years. What fraction remains after 11,460 years?
